key_points: Former Hurricane Ida caused significant damage across Mullica Hill and other South Jersey towns.
Approximately a dozen houses were 'flattened' in Harrison, with no fatalities reported.
Two individuals were hospitalized in Gloucester County due to the storm.
Gov. Phil Murphy has promised support for the response and recovery efforts.
Multiple tornado warnings were issued, with possible tornadoes reported in Cherry Hill and near the Delaware River in Burlington County.
U.S. Rep Andy Kim reported seeing a tornado and urged safety and outreach for help.
Fallen trees, closed roads, and downed power lines were widespread, creating hazardous conditions.
First responders and the Red Cross are actively providing assistance and emergency housing.
Ida is forecasted to bring drenching rainfall, severe thunderstorms, and gusts up to 25 mph to the area.
New Jersey has seen a significant increase in tornado activity in 2021, with 10 tornadoes already reported.
